candidates.title: ref: Improve Hub concurrency docs
candidates.body: This explains the parallelism and concurrency story around Hubs with added examples of parallel multithreading and concurrent futures usage.

candidates.title: feat(transport): Add option to disable SSL verification
candidates.body:
Adding this option will allow to use self-signed certificates in the user's self-hosted environments.

Using this option also allows to use any types of certs, even expired which can introduce vulnerabilities, since all the certificates are trusted by default. That's why we must make clear that it's a last resort if there is no possibility to use legitimate certificate (e.g. Let's Encrypt or similar).


related https://github.com/getsentry/relay/issues/1499

candidates.title: feat(profiling): Update to new standard Profile format
candidates.body:
This PR implements the new standard format for a Profile that will be used across all the different SDKs.

Relay related PR: [#1462](https://github.com/getsentry/relay/pull/1462)

candidates.title: feat(contexts): Add Windows OS version to OS context
candidates.body:
Add Windows OS version to the `Context::Os` context. A test was also added to verify that the version string we're getting back is non-empty and not equal to the `Version::Unknown` version from the `os_info` crate.

On my windows machine, this will give a version string of `10.0.19044`. Previously, all windows crashes reported had the version reported as `Unknown`.

Fixes #500

candidates.title: feat(profiling): Use frame-pointer for stack unwinding and update to pprof 0.10.1
candidates.body:
Once we'll create a doc section for profiling we'll have to make clear that on Linux this requires the following extra steps:

1. recompiling build-std : `cargo +nightly run -Z build-std --target x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu`
2. force frame-pointers with rustflags: `RUSTFLAGS="-C force-frame-pointers=yes" cargo build --release`

candidates.title: ref: Add a tower-http feature as a shortcut
candidates.body:
The new feature activates the sentry-tower/http feature, as otherwise one would have to
declare sentry-tower separately which can lead to out-of-sync dependency versions.

This also fixes all the new clippy lints as a drive-by change, those should be rather minimal.

candidates.title: fix: Turn of pprof default features
candidates.body:
One of the pprof default features (`cpp`) pulls in `symbolic-demangle`,
which is used for demangling, but we don't use that feature at all since
we are only interested in raw instruction addrs which we symbolicate and
demangle server-side.

candidates.title: Take advantage of weak features in Rust 1.60 for TLS enablement
candidates.body:
Previously it was impossible to have a unified feature named `rustls` or `native-tls` that would turn on the respective TLS backend in the chosen transport (`reqwest` or `ureq`) as a feature of `<crate>/tls` would implicitly turn on `<crate>`.  Since Rust 1.60 it is now possible to specify this crate-feature enablement through the use of the question mark in `<crate>?/tls`, which will only enable the `tls` feature if `<crate>` was enabled through other means (another feature).

Secondly we can now also let optional crates have the same name as a feature, and use `dep:<crate>` to refer to the crate instead of the dependency, making for a more pleasant experience without renames to underscore suffixes.

---

Filing this as draft just to get the word out and discuss this for a bit, as it will only be mergeable in 6 months in accordance with the MSRV policy.  It goes without saying that this is a breaking change.

Also note that I haven't renamed other optional crates like `anyhow_`, `log_` etc yet, until this is accepted as a (future) solution.

chosen_pr.title: feat(profiling): Update to new standard Profile format
chosen_pr.body:
This PR implements the new standard format for a Profile that will be used across all the different SDKs.

Relay related PR: [#1462](https://github.com/getsentry/relay/pull/1462)
